result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan C O'Dwyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Per RCSO, DNA collected - 10-31-22 @9:50

9:03 AM Defendant Ryan C O'Dwyer in court.  Attorney Timothy J. O'Donoghue and Chris Briggs in court for Ryan C O'Dwyer.  Attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Defense has filed a plea form.  State files an amended information. Upon plea to all 3 counts the State would recommend fines on all counts leaving the amount to the court. Court performs plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters his plea.  Parties make sentencing arguments.  
Plea:
Ct. 1- GUILTY
Ct. 2- GUILTY
Ct. 3- GUILTY

Ct. 3- GUILTY, $200 FINE, COURT COSTS, DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE, 60 DAYS TO PAY.

copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:52 PM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan C Odwyer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alexander Lee Hahn appeared by video for Ryan C Odwyer. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on June 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
